ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Resists [was: Finally :)]
ygData.msgSnippet: Hiyas Musiker! Glad to see you back! I only participated on a naggy raid and just went in ordinary full lambent except for the helm (SSB sold my other helm a
ygData.messageBody:
Hiyas Musiker!

Glad to see you back! I only participated on a naggy raid and just went in
ordinary full lambent except for the helm (SSB sold my other helm a while
back) and boots (singing steel). I think only other resist gear I had on me
at the time was my runed bone fork. :-P I was given short notice, so I went
there with all I had on.

Anyway, fully buffed, and weaving my rhythm songs my resists were probably
in the 150-200 range. Never got feared, I don't remember if I got burned,
but it didn't matter anyway. All our tanks died against Naggy, leaving just
me, an enchanter and a cleric in my particular group and Naggy at half health.

A bard as the only tank left against Naggy is a bad thing. Had to have the
rescue team scrape my armor off of his foot. :-P

This was a pick-up dragon group, so by all means, wait until a well
organized raid is setup. While they were good enough to get us through the
giants, they didn't have enough firepower to finish Naggy off (only 2
wizards). I believe a good guild can whip through and kill Naggie pretty
quickly, maybe an average of 4 hours? Mine took almost 8 hours (including
all the corpse recovery and resses afterwards). Ugh, quite the nightmare.

---Windleaf



At 10:47 AM 3/24/01 -0600, Bill Mann wrote:
>Another thing about raids that I learned not long ago... If your guild has a
>raid planned, and some folks are already there (kind of like apick-up
>group), DO NOT GO! :op 8 full groups, and everyone died (and we were led
>through the pit , of all places). IIRC, the raid leader's entire strategy
>came from the movie Ghostbusters... "Get her!" Oy vey.
>
>Back to the topic though, with singing Elemental Rhythms and some cleric
>buffs, my resists were all near 200 and she laid not a single spell on me.
>Claws and teeth on the other hand...
>
>-=B=-
>The Rathe

>From: "Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)" <garramone@...>

>Subject: RE: [eqbards] Resists [was: Finally :)]
